../johnstone-bloomreach-v14--latest-code/johnstonesupply-cms/site/components/src/main/java/com/johnstonesupply/cms/servlet/AceChemicalResource.java

3 issue(s)
ERROR Line 36:2
REST endpoint 'getApplications' missing authentication
security.rest-authentication Security Issues
Show details 
REST endpoint 'getApplications' (GET) does not have authentication configured.

**Security Risk**: CRITICAL - Unauthorized access to API endpoints

**Why This Is Dangerous**:
- API endpoints are directly accessible via HTTP
- No authentication means anyone can call the endpoint
- Can expose sensitive data or operations
- Common target for automated attacks
- May violate compliance requirements (GDPR, HIPAA, etc.)

**Problem Pattern**:
```java
// ❌ PROBLEM - No authentication
@Path("/api/users")
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        // Anyone can access this!
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**Correct Patterns**:

**1. JAX-RS with @RolesAllowed** (Recommended):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    @RolesAllowed({"admin", "user"})  // Add this!
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**2. Spring with @PreAuthorize**:
```java
@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/users")
public class UserController {
    @GetMapping("/{id}")
    @PreAuthorize("hasRole('ADMIN') or hasRole('USER')")  // Add this!
    public User getUser(@PathVariable String id) {
        return userService.getUser(id);
    }
}
```

**3. Class-Level Security** (applies to all methods):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
@RolesAllowed("user")  // Applies to all endpoints
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }

    @POST
    @RolesAllowed("admin")  // Override for specific method
    public Response createUser(User user) {
        return Response.ok(userService.create(user)).build();
    }
}
```

**4. Manual Authentication Check** (when annotations don't work):
```java
@GET
@Path("/{id}")
public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id, @Context SecurityContext sc) {
    // Manual check
    if (sc.getUserPrincipal() == null) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.UNAUTHORIZED).build();
    }

    // Check role
    if (!sc.isUserInRole("user")) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.FORBIDDEN).build();
    }

    return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
}
```

**5. Public Endpoint** (explicitly mark as public):
```java
@GET
@Path("/health")
@PermitAll  // Explicitly mark as public
public Response healthCheck() {
    return Response.ok("OK").build();
}
```

**Common Bloomreach Roles**:
- `admin` - Full administrative access
- `author` - Content authors
- `editor` - Content editors
- `developer` - Developers
- `xm.rest.user` - REST API access
- `xm.rest.admin` - REST API administrative access

**Configuration**:
Ensure authentication is configured in web.xml:
```xml
<security-constraint>
    <web-resource-collection>
        <web-resource-name>REST API</web-resource-name>
        <url-pattern>/api/*</url-pattern>
    </web-resource-collection>
    <auth-constraint>
        <role-name>xm.rest.user</role-name>
    </auth-constraint>
</security-constraint>
```

**Testing**:
```bash
# Test without auth (should fail)
curl http://localhost:8080/api/users/123

# Test with auth
curl -u admin:admin http://localhost:8080/api/users/123
```

**When to Use Each Approach**:
- @RolesAllowed: Standard approach for most endpoints
- @PermitAll: Explicitly public endpoints (health checks, documentation)
- @DenyAll: Deprecated or disabled endpoints
- Manual check: Custom authentication logic

**Related Issues**:
- CORS configuration for cross-origin requests
- CSRF protection for state-changing operations
- Rate limiting for public APIs

**References**:
- [JAX-RS Security](https://docs.oracle.com/javaee/7/tutorial/security-jaxrs002.htm)
- [Bloomreach REST API Security](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [OWASP API Security Top 10](https://owasp.org/www-project-api-security/)
ERROR Line 49:2
REST endpoint 'getFeaturesForApplication' missing authentication
security.rest-authentication Security Issues
Show details 
REST endpoint 'getFeaturesForApplication' (GET) does not have authentication configured.

**Security Risk**: CRITICAL - Unauthorized access to API endpoints

**Why This Is Dangerous**:
- API endpoints are directly accessible via HTTP
- No authentication means anyone can call the endpoint
- Can expose sensitive data or operations
- Common target for automated attacks
- May violate compliance requirements (GDPR, HIPAA, etc.)

**Problem Pattern**:
```java
// ❌ PROBLEM - No authentication
@Path("/api/users")
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        // Anyone can access this!
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**Correct Patterns**:

**1. JAX-RS with @RolesAllowed** (Recommended):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    @RolesAllowed({"admin", "user"})  // Add this!
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**2. Spring with @PreAuthorize**:
```java
@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/users")
public class UserController {
    @GetMapping("/{id}")
    @PreAuthorize("hasRole('ADMIN') or hasRole('USER')")  // Add this!
    public User getUser(@PathVariable String id) {
        return userService.getUser(id);
    }
}
```

**3. Class-Level Security** (applies to all methods):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
@RolesAllowed("user")  // Applies to all endpoints
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }

    @POST
    @RolesAllowed("admin")  // Override for specific method
    public Response createUser(User user) {
        return Response.ok(userService.create(user)).build();
    }
}
```

**4. Manual Authentication Check** (when annotations don't work):
```java
@GET
@Path("/{id}")
public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id, @Context SecurityContext sc) {
    // Manual check
    if (sc.getUserPrincipal() == null) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.UNAUTHORIZED).build();
    }

    // Check role
    if (!sc.isUserInRole("user")) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.FORBIDDEN).build();
    }

    return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
}
```

**5. Public Endpoint** (explicitly mark as public):
```java
@GET
@Path("/health")
@PermitAll  // Explicitly mark as public
public Response healthCheck() {
    return Response.ok("OK").build();
}
```

**Common Bloomreach Roles**:
- `admin` - Full administrative access
- `author` - Content authors
- `editor` - Content editors
- `developer` - Developers
- `xm.rest.user` - REST API access
- `xm.rest.admin` - REST API administrative access

**Configuration**:
Ensure authentication is configured in web.xml:
```xml
<security-constraint>
    <web-resource-collection>
        <web-resource-name>REST API</web-resource-name>
        <url-pattern>/api/*</url-pattern>
    </web-resource-collection>
    <auth-constraint>
        <role-name>xm.rest.user</role-name>
    </auth-constraint>
</security-constraint>
```

**Testing**:
```bash
# Test without auth (should fail)
curl http://localhost:8080/api/users/123

# Test with auth
curl -u admin:admin http://localhost:8080/api/users/123
```

**When to Use Each Approach**:
- @RolesAllowed: Standard approach for most endpoints
- @PermitAll: Explicitly public endpoints (health checks, documentation)
- @DenyAll: Deprecated or disabled endpoints
- Manual check: Custom authentication logic

**Related Issues**:
- CORS configuration for cross-origin requests
- CSRF protection for state-changing operations
- Rate limiting for public APIs

**References**:
- [JAX-RS Security](https://docs.oracle.com/javaee/7/tutorial/security-jaxrs002.htm)
- [Bloomreach REST API Security](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [OWASP API Security Top 10](https://owasp.org/www-project-api-security/)

../johnstone-bloomreach-v14--latest-code/johnstonesupply-cms/site/components/src/main/java/com/johnstonesupply/cms/servlet/ExportProductListToExcelResource.java

1 issue(s)
ERROR Line 59:5
REST endpoint 'productListToExcel' missing authentication
security.rest-authentication Security Issues
Show details 
REST endpoint 'productListToExcel' (POST) does not have authentication configured.

**Security Risk**: CRITICAL - Unauthorized access to API endpoints

**Why This Is Dangerous**:
- API endpoints are directly accessible via HTTP
- No authentication means anyone can call the endpoint
- Can expose sensitive data or operations
- Common target for automated attacks
- May violate compliance requirements (GDPR, HIPAA, etc.)

**Problem Pattern**:

**3. Class-Level Security** (applies to all methods):
```java

    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }

    @POST
    @RolesAllowed("admin")  // Override for specific method
    public Response createUser(User user) {
        return Response.ok(userService.create(user)).build();
    }
}
```

**4. Manual Authentication Check** (when annotations don't work):
```java
@GET
@Path("/{id}")
public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id, @Context SecurityContext sc) {
    // Manual check
    if (sc.getUserPrincipal() == null) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.UNAUTHORIZED).build();
    }

    // Check role
    if (!sc.isUserInRole("user")) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.FORBIDDEN).build();
    }

    return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
}
```

**5. Public Endpoint** (explicitly mark as public):
```java
@GET
@Path("/health")
@PermitAll  // Explicitly mark as public
public Response healthCheck() {
    return Response.ok("OK").build();
}
```

**Common Bloomreach Roles**:
- `admin` - Full administrative access
- `author` - Content authors
- `editor` - Content editors
- `developer` - Developers
- `xm.rest.user` - REST API access
- `xm.rest.admin` - REST API administrative access

**Configuration**:
Ensure authentication is configured in web.xml:
```xml
<security-constraint>
    <web-resource-collection>
        <web-resource-name>REST API</web-resource-name>
        <url-pattern>/api/*</url-pattern>
    </web-resource-collection>
    <auth-constraint>
        <role-name>xm.rest.user</role-name>
    </auth-constraint>
</security-constraint>
```

**Testing**:
```bash
# Test without auth (should fail)
curl http://localhost:8080/api/users/123

# Test with auth
curl -u admin:admin http://localhost:8080/api/users/123
```

**When to Use Each Approach**:
- @RolesAllowed: Standard approach for most endpoints
- @PermitAll: Explicitly public endpoints (health checks, documentation)
- @DenyAll: Deprecated or disabled endpoints
- Manual check: Custom authentication logic

**Related Issues**:
- CORS configuration for cross-origin requests
- CSRF protection for state-changing operations
- Rate limiting for public APIs

**References**:
- [JAX-RS Security](https://docs.oracle.com/javaee/7/tutorial/security-jaxrs002.htm)
- [Bloomreach REST API Security](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [OWASP API Security Top 10](https://owasp.org/www-project-api-security/)

../johnstone-bloomreach-v14--latest-code/johnstonesupply-cms/site/components/src/main/java/com/johnstonesupply/cms/servlet/PartstockResource.java

6 issue(s)
ERROR Line 43:5
REST endpoint 'getPartstocks' missing authentication
security.rest-authentication Security Issues
Show details 
REST endpoint 'getPartstocks' (GET) does not have authentication configured.

**Security Risk**: CRITICAL - Unauthorized access to API endpoints

**Why This Is Dangerous**:
- API endpoints are directly accessible via HTTP
- No authentication means anyone can call the endpoint
- Can expose sensitive data or operations
- Common target for automated attacks
- May violate compliance requirements (GDPR, HIPAA, etc.)

**Problem Pattern**:
```java
// ❌ PROBLEM - No authentication
@Path("/api/users")
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        // Anyone can access this!
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**Correct Patterns**:

**1. JAX-RS with @RolesAllowed** (Recommended):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    @RolesAllowed({"admin", "user"})  // Add this!
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**2. Spring with @PreAuthorize**:
```java
@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/users")
public class UserController {
    @GetMapping("/{id}")
    @PreAuthorize("hasRole('ADMIN') or hasRole('USER')")  // Add this!
    public User getUser(@PathVariable String id) {
        return userService.getUser(id);
    }
}
```

**3. Class-Level Security** (applies to all methods):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
@RolesAllowed("user")  // Applies to all endpoints
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }

    @POST
    @RolesAllowed("admin")  // Override for specific method
    public Response createUser(User user) {
        return Response.ok(userService.create(user)).build();
    }
}
```

**4. Manual Authentication Check** (when annotations don't work):
```java
@GET
@Path("/{id}")
public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id, @Context SecurityContext sc) {
    // Manual check
    if (sc.getUserPrincipal() == null) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.UNAUTHORIZED).build();
    }

    // Check role
    if (!sc.isUserInRole("user")) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.FORBIDDEN).build();
    }

    return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
}
```

**5. Public Endpoint** (explicitly mark as public):
```java
@GET
@Path("/health")
@PermitAll  // Explicitly mark as public
public Response healthCheck() {
    return Response.ok("OK").build();
}
```

**Common Bloomreach Roles**:
- `admin` - Full administrative access
- `author` - Content authors
- `editor` - Content editors
- `developer` - Developers
- `xm.rest.user` - REST API access
- `xm.rest.admin` - REST API administrative access

**Configuration**:
Ensure authentication is configured in web.xml:
```xml
<security-constraint>
    <web-resource-collection>
        <web-resource-name>REST API</web-resource-name>
        <url-pattern>/api/*</url-pattern>
    </web-resource-collection>
    <auth-constraint>
        <role-name>xm.rest.user</role-name>
    </auth-constraint>
</security-constraint>
```

**Testing**:
```bash
# Test without auth (should fail)
curl http://localhost:8080/api/users/123

# Test with auth
curl -u admin:admin http://localhost:8080/api/users/123
```

**When to Use Each Approach**:
- @RolesAllowed: Standard approach for most endpoints
- @PermitAll: Explicitly public endpoints (health checks, documentation)
- @DenyAll: Deprecated or disabled endpoints
- Manual check: Custom authentication logic

**Related Issues**:
- CORS configuration for cross-origin requests
- CSRF protection for state-changing operations
- Rate limiting for public APIs

**References**:
- [JAX-RS Security](https://docs.oracle.com/javaee/7/tutorial/security-jaxrs002.htm)
- [Bloomreach REST API Security](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [OWASP API Security Top 10](https://owasp.org/www-project-api-security/)

**Security Risk**: CRITICAL - Unauthorized access to API endpoints

**Why This Is Dangerous**:
- API endpoints are directly accessible via HTTP
- No authentication means anyone can call the endpoint
- Can expose sensitive data or operations
- Common target for automated attacks
- May violate compliance requirements (GDPR, HIPAA, etc.)

```java

    }
}
```

```java

    public User getUser(@PathVariable String id) {
        return userService.getUser(id);
    }
}
```

```java
@Path("/api/users")

    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }

    @POST
    @RolesAllowed("admin")  // Override for specific method
    public Response createUser(User user) {
        return Response.ok(userService.create(user)).build();
    }
}
```

**4. Manual Authentication Check** (when annotations don't work):
```java
@GET
@Path("/{id}")
public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id, @Context SecurityContext sc) {
    // Manual check
    if (sc.getUserPrincipal() == null) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.UNAUTHORIZED).build();
    }

    // Check role
    if (!sc.isUserInRole("user")) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.FORBIDDEN).build();
    }

    return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
}
```

**5. Public Endpoint** (explicitly mark as public):
```java
@GET
@Path("/health")
@PermitAll  // Explicitly mark as public
public Response healthCheck() {
    return Response.ok("OK").build();
}
```

- `admin` - Full administrative access
- `author` - Content authors
- `editor` - Content editors
- `developer` - Developers

- `xm.rest.admin` - REST API administrative access

```java
        return Response.ok(userService.create(user)).build();
    }
}
```

**4. Manual Authentication Check** (when annotations don't work):
```java
@GET
@Path("/{id}")
public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id, @Context SecurityContext sc) {
    // Manual check
    if (sc.getUserPrincipal() == null) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.UNAUTHORIZED).build();
    }

    // Check role
    if (!sc.isUserInRole("user")) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.FORBIDDEN).build();
    }

    return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
}
```

**5. Public Endpoint** (explicitly mark as public):
```java
@GET
@Path("/health")
@PermitAll  // Explicitly mark as public
public Response healthCheck() {
    return Response.ok("OK").build();
}
```

**Common Bloomreach Roles**:
- `admin` - Full administrative access
- `author` - Content authors
- `editor` - Content editors
- `developer` - Developers
- `xm.rest.user` - REST API access
- `xm.rest.admin` - REST API administrative access

**Configuration**:
Ensure authentication is configured in web.xml:
```xml
<security-constraint>
    <web-resource-collection>
        <web-resource-name>REST API</web-resource-name>
        <url-pattern>/api/*</url-pattern>
    </web-resource-collection>
    <auth-constraint>
        <role-name>xm.rest.user</role-name>
    </auth-constraint>
</security-constraint>
```

**Testing**:
```bash
# Test without auth (should fail)
curl http://localhost:8080/api/users/123

# Test with auth
curl -u admin:admin http://localhost:8080/api/users/123
```

**When to Use Each Approach**:
- @RolesAllowed: Standard approach for most endpoints
- @PermitAll: Explicitly public endpoints (health checks, documentation)
- @DenyAll: Deprecated or disabled endpoints
- Manual check: Custom authentication logic

**Related Issues**:
- CORS configuration for cross-origin requests
- CSRF protection for state-changing operations
- Rate limiting for public APIs

**References**:
- [JAX-RS Security](https://docs.oracle.com/javaee/7/tutorial/security-jaxrs002.htm)
- [Bloomreach REST API Security](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [OWASP API Security Top 10](https://owasp.org/www-project-api-security/)

../johnstone-bloomreach-v14--latest-code/johnstonesupply-cms/site/components/src/main/java/com/johnstonesupply/cms/servlet/ProductListResource.java

14 issue(s)
ERROR Line 75:5
REST endpoint 'saveProductList' missing authentication
security.rest-authentication Security Issues
Show details 
REST endpoint 'saveProductList' (POST) does not have authentication configured.

**Security Risk**: CRITICAL - Unauthorized access to API endpoints

**Why This Is Dangerous**:
- API endpoints are directly accessible via HTTP
- No authentication means anyone can call the endpoint
- Can expose sensitive data or operations
- Common target for automated attacks
- May violate compliance requirements (GDPR, HIPAA, etc.)

**Problem Pattern**:
```java
// ❌ PROBLEM - No authentication
@Path("/api/users")
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        // Anyone can access this!
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**Correct Patterns**:

**1. JAX-RS with @RolesAllowed** (Recommended):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    @RolesAllowed({"admin", "user"})  // Add this!
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**2. Spring with @PreAuthorize**:
```java
@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/users")
public class UserController {
    @GetMapping("/{id}")
    @PreAuthorize("hasRole('ADMIN') or hasRole('USER')")  // Add this!
    public User getUser(@PathVariable String id) {
        return userService.getUser(id);
    }
}
```

**3. Class-Level Security** (applies to all methods):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
@RolesAllowed("user")  // Applies to all endpoints
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }

    @POST
    @RolesAllowed("admin")  // Override for specific method
    public Response createUser(User user) {
        return Response.ok(userService.create(user)).build();
    }
}
```

**4. Manual Authentication Check** (when annotations don't work):
```java
@GET
@Path("/{id}")
public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id, @Context SecurityContext sc) {
    // Manual check
    if (sc.getUserPrincipal() == null) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.UNAUTHORIZED).build();
    }

    // Check role
    if (!sc.isUserInRole("user")) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.FORBIDDEN).build();
    }

    return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
}
```

**5. Public Endpoint** (explicitly mark as public):
```java
@GET
@Path("/health")
@PermitAll  // Explicitly mark as public
public Response healthCheck() {
    return Response.ok("OK").build();
}
```

**Common Bloomreach Roles**:
- `admin` - Full administrative access
- `author` - Content authors
- `editor` - Content editors
- `developer` - Developers
- `xm.rest.user` - REST API access
- `xm.rest.admin` - REST API administrative access

**Configuration**:
Ensure authentication is configured in web.xml:
```xml
<security-constraint>
    <web-resource-collection>
        <web-resource-name>REST API</web-resource-name>
        <url-pattern>/api/*</url-pattern>
    </web-resource-collection>
    <auth-constraint>
        <role-name>xm.rest.user</role-name>
    </auth-constraint>
</security-constraint>
```

**Testing**:
```bash
# Test without auth (should fail)
curl http://localhost:8080/api/users/123

# Test with auth
curl -u admin:admin http://localhost:8080/api/users/123
```

**When to Use Each Approach**:
- @RolesAllowed: Standard approach for most endpoints
- @PermitAll: Explicitly public endpoints (health checks, documentation)
- @DenyAll: Deprecated or disabled endpoints
- Manual check: Custom authentication logic

**Related Issues**:
- CORS configuration for cross-origin requests
- CSRF protection for state-changing operations
- Rate limiting for public APIs

**References**:
- [JAX-RS Security](https://docs.oracle.com/javaee/7/tutorial/security-jaxrs002.htm)
- [Bloomreach REST API Security](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [OWASP API Security Top 10](https://owasp.org/www-project-api-security/)
ERROR Line 99:5
REST endpoint 'getFoldersAndListsWithoutFolder' missing authentication
security.rest-authentication Security Issues
Show details 
REST endpoint 'getFoldersAndListsWithoutFolder' (GET) does not have authentication configured.

**Security Risk**: CRITICAL - Unauthorized access to API endpoints

**Why This Is Dangerous**:
- API endpoints are directly accessible via HTTP
- No authentication means anyone can call the endpoint
- Can expose sensitive data or operations
- Common target for automated attacks
- May violate compliance requirements (GDPR, HIPAA, etc.)

**Problem Pattern**:
```java
// ❌ PROBLEM - No authentication

    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        // Anyone can access this!
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**Correct Patterns**:

**1. JAX-RS with @RolesAllowed** (Recommended):
```java
@Path("/api/users")

    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    @RolesAllowed({"admin", "user"})  // Add this!
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**2. Spring with @PreAuthorize**:
```java
@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/users")
public class UserController {
    @GetMapping("/{id}")
    @PreAuthorize("hasRole('ADMIN') or hasRole('USER')")  // Add this!
    public User getUser(@PathVariable String id) {
        return userService.getUser(id);
    }
}
```

**3. Class-Level Security** (applies to all methods):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
@RolesAllowed("user")  // Applies to all endpoints
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }

    @POST
    @RolesAllowed("admin")  // Override for specific method
    public Response createUser(User user) {
        return Response.ok(userService.create(user)).build();
    }
}
```

**4. Manual Authentication Check** (when annotations don't work):
```java
@GET
@Path("/{id}")
public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id, @Context SecurityContext sc) {
    // Manual check
    if (sc.getUserPrincipal() == null) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.UNAUTHORIZED).build();
    }

    // Check role
    if (!sc.isUserInRole("user")) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.FORBIDDEN).build();
    }

    return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
}
```

**5. Public Endpoint** (explicitly mark as public):
```java
@GET
@Path("/health")
@PermitAll  // Explicitly mark as public
public Response healthCheck() {
    return Response.ok("OK").build();
}
```

**Common Bloomreach Roles**:
- `admin` - Full administrative access
- `author` - Content authors
- `editor` - Content editors
- `developer` - Developers
- `xm.rest.user` - REST API access
- `xm.rest.admin` - REST API administrative access

**Configuration**:
Ensure authentication is configured in web.xml:
```xml

    <web-resource-collection>
        <web-resource-name>REST API</web-resource-name>
        <url-pattern>/api/*</url-pattern>
    </web-resource-collection>

        <role-name>xm.rest.user</role-name>
    </auth-constraint>
</security-constraint>
```

- @DenyAll: Deprecated or disabled endpoints

- API endpoints are directly accessible via HTTP

```java
@GET
@Path("/{id}")
public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id, @Context SecurityContext sc) {
    // Manual check
    if (sc.getUserPrincipal() == null) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.UNAUTHORIZED).build();
    }

    // Check role
    if (!sc.isUserInRole("user")) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.FORBIDDEN).build();
    }

    return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
}
```

**5. Public Endpoint** (explicitly mark as public):
```java
@GET
@Path("/health")
@PermitAll  // Explicitly mark as public
public Response healthCheck() {
    return Response.ok("OK").build();
}
```

**Common Bloomreach Roles**:
- `admin` - Full administrative access
- `author` - Content authors
- `editor` - Content editors
- `developer` - Developers
- `xm.rest.user` - REST API access
- `xm.rest.admin` - REST API administrative access

**Configuration**:
Ensure authentication is configured in web.xml:
```xml
<security-constraint>
    <web-resource-collection>
        <web-resource-name>REST API</web-resource-name>
        <url-pattern>/api/*</url-pattern>
    </web-resource-collection>
    <auth-constraint>
        <role-name>xm.rest.user</role-name>
    </auth-constraint>
</security-constraint>
```

**Testing**:
```bash
# Test without auth (should fail)
curl http://localhost:8080/api/users/123

# Test with auth
curl -u admin:admin http://localhost:8080/api/users/123
```

**When to Use Each Approach**:
- @RolesAllowed: Standard approach for most endpoints
- @PermitAll: Explicitly public endpoints (health checks, documentation)
- @DenyAll: Deprecated or disabled endpoints
- Manual check: Custom authentication logic

**Related Issues**:
- CORS configuration for cross-origin requests
- CSRF protection for state-changing operations
- Rate limiting for public APIs

**References**:
- [JAX-RS Security](https://docs.oracle.com/javaee/7/tutorial/security-jaxrs002.htm)
- [Bloomreach REST API Security](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [OWASP API Security Top 10](https://owasp.org/www-project-api-security/)
ERROR Line 199:5
REST endpoint 'deleteProductList' missing authentication
security.rest-authentication Security Issues
Show details 
REST endpoint 'deleteProductList' (DELETE) does not have authentication configured.

**Security Risk**: CRITICAL - Unauthorized access to API endpoints

**Why This Is Dangerous**:
- API endpoints are directly accessible via HTTP
- No authentication means anyone can call the endpoint
- Can expose sensitive data or operations
- Common target for automated attacks
- May violate compliance requirements (GDPR, HIPAA, etc.)

**Problem Pattern**:
```java
// ❌ PROBLEM - No authentication
@Path("/api/users")
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        // Anyone can access this!
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**Correct Patterns**:

**1. JAX-RS with @RolesAllowed** (Recommended):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    @RolesAllowed({"admin", "user"})  // Add this!
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**2. Spring with @PreAuthorize**:
```java
@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/users")
public class UserController {
    @GetMapping("/{id}")
    @PreAuthorize("hasRole('ADMIN') or hasRole('USER')")  // Add this!
    public User getUser(@PathVariable String id) {
        return userService.getUser(id);
    }
}
```

**3. Class-Level Security** (applies to all methods):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
@RolesAllowed("user")  // Applies to all endpoints
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }

    @POST
    @RolesAllowed("admin")  // Override for specific method
    public Response createUser(User user) {
        return Response.ok(userService.create(user)).build();
    }
}
```

**4. Manual Authentication Check** (when annotations don't work):
```java
@GET
@Path("/{id}")
public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id, @Context SecurityContext sc) {
    // Manual check
    if (sc.getUserPrincipal() == null) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.UNAUTHORIZED).build();
    }

    // Check role
    if (!sc.isUserInRole("user")) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.FORBIDDEN).build();
    }

    return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
}
```

**5. Public Endpoint** (explicitly mark as public):
```java
@GET
@Path("/health")
@PermitAll  // Explicitly mark as public
public Response healthCheck() {
    return Response.ok("OK").build();
}
```

**Common Bloomreach Roles**:
- `admin` - Full administrative access
- `author` - Content authors
- `editor` - Content editors
- `developer` - Developers
- `xm.rest.user` - REST API access
- `xm.rest.admin` - REST API administrative access

**Configuration**:
Ensure authentication is configured in web.xml:
```xml
<security-constraint>
    <web-resource-collection>
        <web-resource-name>REST API</web-resource-name>
        <url-pattern>/api/*</url-pattern>
    </web-resource-collection>
    <auth-constraint>
        <role-name>xm.rest.user</role-name>
    </auth-constraint>
</security-constraint>
```

**Testing**:
```bash
# Test without auth (should fail)
curl http://localhost:8080/api/users/123

# Test with auth
curl -u admin:admin http://localhost:8080/api/users/123
```

**When to Use Each Approach**:
- @RolesAllowed: Standard approach for most endpoints
- @PermitAll: Explicitly public endpoints (health checks, documentation)
- @DenyAll: Deprecated or disabled endpoints
- Manual check: Custom authentication logic

**Related Issues**:
- CORS configuration for cross-origin requests
- CSRF protection for state-changing operations
- Rate limiting for public APIs

**References**:
- [JAX-RS Security](https://docs.oracle.com/javaee/7/tutorial/security-jaxrs002.htm)
- [Bloomreach REST API Security](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [OWASP API Security Top 10](https://owasp.org/www-project-api-security/)

```java
        return Response.status(Response.Status.FORBIDDEN).build();
    }

    return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
}
```

**5. Public Endpoint** (explicitly mark as public):
```java
@GET
@Path("/health")
@PermitAll  // Explicitly mark as public
public Response healthCheck() {
    return Response.ok("OK").build();
}
```

**Common Bloomreach Roles**:
- `admin` - Full administrative access
- `author` - Content authors
- `editor` - Content editors
- `developer` - Developers
- `xm.rest.user` - REST API access
- `xm.rest.admin` - REST API administrative access

**Configuration**:
Ensure authentication is configured in web.xml:
```xml
<security-constraint>
    <web-resource-collection>
        <web-resource-name>REST API</web-resource-name>
        <url-pattern>/api/*</url-pattern>
    </web-resource-collection>
    <auth-constraint>
        <role-name>xm.rest.user</role-name>
    </auth-constraint>
</security-constraint>
```

**Testing**:
```bash
# Test without auth (should fail)
curl http://localhost:8080/api/users/123

# Test with auth
curl -u admin:admin http://localhost:8080/api/users/123
```

**When to Use Each Approach**:
- @RolesAllowed: Standard approach for most endpoints
- @PermitAll: Explicitly public endpoints (health checks, documentation)
- @DenyAll: Deprecated or disabled endpoints
- Manual check: Custom authentication logic

**Related Issues**:
- CORS configuration for cross-origin requests
- CSRF protection for state-changing operations
- Rate limiting for public APIs

**References**:
- [JAX-RS Security](https://docs.oracle.com/javaee/7/tutorial/security-jaxrs002.htm)
- [Bloomreach REST API Security](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [OWASP API Security Top 10](https://owasp.org/www-project-api-security/)
ERROR Line 313:5
REST endpoint 'getEditableFoldersAndListsWithoutFolder' missing authentication
security.rest-authentication Security Issues
Show details 
REST endpoint 'getEditableFoldersAndListsWithoutFolder' (GET) does not have authentication configured.

**Security Risk**: CRITICAL - Unauthorized access to API endpoints

**Why This Is Dangerous**:
- API endpoints are directly accessible via HTTP
- No authentication means anyone can call the endpoint
- Can expose sensitive data or operations
- Common target for automated attacks
- May violate compliance requirements (GDPR, HIPAA, etc.)

**Problem Pattern**:
```java
// ❌ PROBLEM - No authentication
@Path("/api/users")
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        // Anyone can access this!
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**Correct Patterns**:

**1. JAX-RS with @RolesAllowed** (Recommended):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    @RolesAllowed({"admin", "user"})  // Add this!
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**2. Spring with @PreAuthorize**:
```java
@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/users")
public class UserController {
    @GetMapping("/{id}")
    @PreAuthorize("hasRole('ADMIN') or hasRole('USER')")  // Add this!
    public User getUser(@PathVariable String id) {
        return userService.getUser(id);
    }
}
```

**3. Class-Level Security** (applies to all methods):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
@RolesAllowed("user")  // Applies to all endpoints
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }

    @POST
    @RolesAllowed("admin")  // Override for specific method
    public Response createUser(User user) {
        return Response.ok(userService.create(user)).build();
    }
}
```

**4. Manual Authentication Check** (when annotations don't work):
```java
@GET
@Path("/{id}")
public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id, @Context SecurityContext sc) {
    // Manual check
    if (sc.getUserPrincipal() == null) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.UNAUTHORIZED).build();
    }

    // Check role
    if (!sc.isUserInRole("user")) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.FORBIDDEN).build();
    }

    return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
}
```

**5. Public Endpoint** (explicitly mark as public):
```java
@GET
@Path("/health")
@PermitAll  // Explicitly mark as public
public Response healthCheck() {
    return Response.ok("OK").build();
}
```

**Common Bloomreach Roles**:
- `admin` - Full administrative access
- `author` - Content authors
- `editor` - Content editors
- `developer` - Developers
- `xm.rest.user` - REST API access
- `xm.rest.admin` - REST API administrative access

**Configuration**:
Ensure authentication is configured in web.xml:
```xml
<security-constraint>
    <web-resource-collection>
        <web-resource-name>REST API</web-resource-name>
        <url-pattern>/api/*</url-pattern>
    </web-resource-collection>
    <auth-constraint>
        <role-name>xm.rest.user</role-name>
    </auth-constraint>
</security-constraint>
```

**Testing**:
```bash
# Test without auth (should fail)
curl http://localhost:8080/api/users/123

# Test with auth
curl -u admin:admin http://localhost:8080/api/users/123
```

**When to Use Each Approach**:
- @RolesAllowed: Standard approach for most endpoints
- @PermitAll: Explicitly public endpoints (health checks, documentation)
- @DenyAll: Deprecated or disabled endpoints
- Manual check: Custom authentication logic

**Related Issues**:
- CORS configuration for cross-origin requests
- CSRF protection for state-changing operations
- Rate limiting for public APIs

**References**:
- [JAX-RS Security](https://docs.oracle.com/javaee/7/tutorial/security-jaxrs002.htm)
- [Bloomreach REST API Security](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [OWASP API Security Top 10](https://owasp.org/www-project-api-security/)

Show details

**Security Risk**: CRITICAL - Unauthorized access to API endpoints

**Why This Is Dangerous**:
- API endpoints are directly accessible via HTTP
- No authentication means anyone can call the endpoint
- Can expose sensitive data or operations
- Common target for automated attacks
- May violate compliance requirements (GDPR, HIPAA, etc.)

```java

    }
}
```

```java
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

```java
    @PreAuthorize("hasRole('ADMIN') or hasRole('USER')")  // Add this!
    public User getUser(@PathVariable String id) {
        return userService.getUser(id);
    }
}
```

```java

        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }

    @POST
    @RolesAllowed("admin")  // Override for specific method
    public Response createUser(User user) {
        return Response.ok(userService.create(user)).build();
    }
}
```

```java
@GET
@Path("/{id}")
public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id, @Context SecurityContext sc) {
    // Manual check
    if (sc.getUserPrincipal() == null) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.UNAUTHORIZED).build();
    }

    // Check role
    if (!sc.isUserInRole("user")) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.FORBIDDEN).build();
    }

    return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
}
```

**5. Public Endpoint** (explicitly mark as public):
```java
@GET
@Path("/health")
@PermitAll  // Explicitly mark as public
public Response healthCheck() {
    return Response.ok("OK").build();
}
```

- `xm.rest.admin` - REST API administrative access

```java
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }

    @POST
    @RolesAllowed("admin")  // Override for specific method
    public Response createUser(User user) {
        return Response.ok(userService.create(user)).build();
    }
}
```

**4. Manual Authentication Check** (when annotations don't work):
```java
@GET
@Path("/{id}")
public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id, @Context SecurityContext sc) {
    // Manual check
    if (sc.getUserPrincipal() == null) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.UNAUTHORIZED).build();
    }

    // Check role
    if (!sc.isUserInRole("user")) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.FORBIDDEN).build();
    }

    return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
}
```

**5. Public Endpoint** (explicitly mark as public):
```java
@GET
@Path("/health")
@PermitAll  // Explicitly mark as public
public Response healthCheck() {
    return Response.ok("OK").build();
}
```

**Common Bloomreach Roles**:
- `admin` - Full administrative access
- `author` - Content authors
- `editor` - Content editors
- `developer` - Developers
- `xm.rest.user` - REST API access
- `xm.rest.admin` - REST API administrative access

**Configuration**:
Ensure authentication is configured in web.xml:
```xml
<security-constraint>
    <web-resource-collection>
        <web-resource-name>REST API</web-resource-name>
        <url-pattern>/api/*</url-pattern>
    </web-resource-collection>
    <auth-constraint>
        <role-name>xm.rest.user</role-name>
    </auth-constraint>
</security-constraint>
```

**Testing**:
```bash
# Test without auth (should fail)
curl http://localhost:8080/api/users/123

# Test with auth
curl -u admin:admin http://localhost:8080/api/users/123
```

**When to Use Each Approach**:
- @RolesAllowed: Standard approach for most endpoints
- @PermitAll: Explicitly public endpoints (health checks, documentation)
- @DenyAll: Deprecated or disabled endpoints
- Manual check: Custom authentication logic

**Related Issues**:
- CORS configuration for cross-origin requests
- CSRF protection for state-changing operations
- Rate limiting for public APIs

**References**:
- [JAX-RS Security](https://docs.oracle.com/javaee/7/tutorial/security-jaxrs002.htm)
- [Bloomreach REST API Security](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [OWASP API Security Top 10](https://owasp.org/www-project-api-security/)

../johnstone-bloomreach-v14--latest-code/johnstonesupply-cms/site/components/src/main/java/com/johnstonesupply/cms/servlet/PricingAndAvailabilityResource.java

1 issue(s)
ERROR Line 45:2
REST endpoint 'getPricingAndAvailabilites' missing authentication
security.rest-authentication Security Issues
Show details 
REST endpoint 'getPricingAndAvailabilites' (POST) does not have authentication configured.

**Security Risk**: CRITICAL - Unauthorized access to API endpoints

**Why This Is Dangerous**:
- API endpoints are directly accessible via HTTP
- No authentication means anyone can call the endpoint
- Can expose sensitive data or operations
- Common target for automated attacks
- May violate compliance requirements (GDPR, HIPAA, etc.)

**Problem Pattern**:
```java
// ❌ PROBLEM - No authentication
@Path("/api/users")
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        // Anyone can access this!
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**Correct Patterns**:

**1. JAX-RS with @RolesAllowed** (Recommended):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    @RolesAllowed({"admin", "user"})  // Add this!
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**2. Spring with @PreAuthorize**:
```java
@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/users")
public class UserController {
    @GetMapping("/{id}")
    @PreAuthorize("hasRole('ADMIN') or hasRole('USER')")  // Add this!
    public User getUser(@PathVariable String id) {
        return userService.getUser(id);
    }
}
```

**3. Class-Level Security** (applies to all methods):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
@RolesAllowed("user")  // Applies to all endpoints
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }

    @POST
    @RolesAllowed("admin")  // Override for specific method
    public Response createUser(User user) {
        return Response.ok(userService.create(user)).build();
    }
}
```

**4. Manual Authentication Check** (when annotations don't work):
```java
@GET
@Path("/{id}")
public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id, @Context SecurityContext sc) {
    // Manual check
    if (sc.getUserPrincipal() == null) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.UNAUTHORIZED).build();
    }

    // Check role
    if (!sc.isUserInRole("user")) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.FORBIDDEN).build();
    }

    return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
}
```

**5. Public Endpoint** (explicitly mark as public):
```java
@GET
@Path("/health")
@PermitAll  // Explicitly mark as public
public Response healthCheck() {
    return Response.ok("OK").build();
}
```

**Common Bloomreach Roles**:
- `admin` - Full administrative access
- `author` - Content authors
- `editor` - Content editors
- `developer` - Developers
- `xm.rest.user` - REST API access
- `xm.rest.admin` - REST API administrative access

**Configuration**:
Ensure authentication is configured in web.xml:
```xml
<security-constraint>
    <web-resource-collection>
        <web-resource-name>REST API</web-resource-name>
        <url-pattern>/api/*</url-pattern>
    </web-resource-collection>
    <auth-constraint>
        <role-name>xm.rest.user</role-name>
    </auth-constraint>
</security-constraint>
```

```bash

# Test with auth
curl -u admin:admin http://localhost:8080/api/users/123
```

- @DenyAll: Deprecated or disabled endpoints

- CSRF protection for state-changing operations
- Rate limiting for public APIs

**Security Risk**: CRITICAL - Unauthorized access to API endpoints

**Why This Is Dangerous**:

- No authentication means anyone can call the endpoint
- Can expose sensitive data or operations

```java
@RolesAllowed("user")  // Applies to all endpoints
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }

    @POST
    @RolesAllowed("admin")  // Override for specific method
    public Response createUser(User user) {
        return Response.ok(userService.create(user)).build();
    }
}
```

**4. Manual Authentication Check** (when annotations don't work):
```java
@GET
@Path("/{id}")
public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id, @Context SecurityContext sc) {
    // Manual check
    if (sc.getUserPrincipal() == null) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.UNAUTHORIZED).build();
    }

    // Check role
    if (!sc.isUserInRole("user")) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.FORBIDDEN).build();
    }

    return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
}
```

**5. Public Endpoint** (explicitly mark as public):
```java
@GET
@Path("/health")
@PermitAll  // Explicitly mark as public
public Response healthCheck() {
    return Response.ok("OK").build();
}
```

**Common Bloomreach Roles**:
- `admin` - Full administrative access
- `author` - Content authors
- `editor` - Content editors
- `developer` - Developers
- `xm.rest.user` - REST API access
- `xm.rest.admin` - REST API administrative access

**Configuration**:
Ensure authentication is configured in web.xml:
```xml
<security-constraint>
    <web-resource-collection>
        <web-resource-name>REST API</web-resource-name>
        <url-pattern>/api/*</url-pattern>
    </web-resource-collection>
    <auth-constraint>
        <role-name>xm.rest.user</role-name>
    </auth-constraint>
</security-constraint>
```

**Testing**:
```bash
# Test without auth (should fail)
curl http://localhost:8080/api/users/123

# Test with auth
curl -u admin:admin http://localhost:8080/api/users/123
```

**When to Use Each Approach**:
- @RolesAllowed: Standard approach for most endpoints
- @PermitAll: Explicitly public endpoints (health checks, documentation)
- @DenyAll: Deprecated or disabled endpoints
- Manual check: Custom authentication logic

**Related Issues**:
- CORS configuration for cross-origin requests
- CSRF protection for state-changing operations
- Rate limiting for public APIs

**References**:
- [JAX-RS Security](https://docs.oracle.com/javaee/7/tutorial/security-jaxrs002.htm)
- [Bloomreach REST API Security](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [OWASP API Security Top 10](https://owasp.org/www-project-api-security/)

../johnstone-bloomreach-v14--latest-code/johnstonesupply-cms/site/components/src/main/java/com/johnstonesupply/cms/servlet/PasswordResource.java

4 issue(s)
ERROR Line 41:33
Hardcoded Password: 'PASSWORD_FORGOTTEN_URI'
security.hardcoded-credentials Security Issues
Show details 
See HardcodedCredentialsInspection for full documentation.

Variable: PASSWORD_FORGOTTEN_URI
Type: Password
Masked Value: /p*************************rm

Use environment variables or external configuration instead.
ERROR Line 43:33
Hardcoded Password: 'PASSWORD_RESET_URI'
security.hardcoded-credentials Security Issues
Show details 
See HardcodedCredentialsInspection for full documentation.

Variable: PASSWORD_RESET_URI
Type: Password
Masked Value: /p***************************************rm

Use environment variables or external configuration instead.
ERROR Line 48:5
REST endpoint 'passwordForgotten' missing authentication
security.rest-authentication Security Issues
Show details 
REST endpoint 'passwordForgotten' (POST) does not have authentication configured.

**Security Risk**: CRITICAL - Unauthorized access to API endpoints

**Why This Is Dangerous**:
- API endpoints are directly accessible via HTTP
- No authentication means anyone can call the endpoint
- Can expose sensitive data or operations
- Common target for automated attacks
- May violate compliance requirements (GDPR, HIPAA, etc.)

**Problem Pattern**:
```java
// ❌ PROBLEM - No authentication
@Path("/api/users")
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        // Anyone can access this!
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**Correct Patterns**:

**1. JAX-RS with @RolesAllowed** (Recommended):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    @RolesAllowed({"admin", "user"})  // Add this!
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**2. Spring with @PreAuthorize**:
```java
@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/users")
public class UserController {
    @GetMapping("/{id}")
    @PreAuthorize("hasRole('ADMIN') or hasRole('USER')")  // Add this!
    public User getUser(@PathVariable String id) {
        return userService.getUser(id);
    }
}
```

**3. Class-Level Security** (applies to all methods):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
@RolesAllowed("user")  // Applies to all endpoints
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }

    @POST
    @RolesAllowed("admin")  // Override for specific method
    public Response createUser(User user) {
        return Response.ok(userService.create(user)).build();
    }
}
```

**4. Manual Authentication Check** (when annotations don't work):
```java
@GET
@Path("/{id}")
public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id, @Context SecurityContext sc) {
    // Manual check
    if (sc.getUserPrincipal() == null) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.UNAUTHORIZED).build();
    }

    // Check role
    if (!sc.isUserInRole("user")) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.FORBIDDEN).build();
    }

    return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
}
```

**5. Public Endpoint** (explicitly mark as public):
```java
@GET
@Path("/health")
@PermitAll  // Explicitly mark as public
public Response healthCheck() {
    return Response.ok("OK").build();
}
```

**Common Bloomreach Roles**:
- `admin` - Full administrative access
- `author` - Content authors
- `editor` - Content editors
- `developer` - Developers
- `xm.rest.user` - REST API access
- `xm.rest.admin` - REST API administrative access

**Configuration**:
Ensure authentication is configured in web.xml:
```xml
<security-constraint>
    <web-resource-collection>
        <web-resource-name>REST API</web-resource-name>
        <url-pattern>/api/*</url-pattern>
    </web-resource-collection>
    <auth-constraint>
        <role-name>xm.rest.user</role-name>
    </auth-constraint>
</security-constraint>
```

**Testing**:
```bash
# Test without auth (should fail)
curl http://localhost:8080/api/users/123

# Test with auth
curl -u admin:admin http://localhost:8080/api/users/123
```

**When to Use Each Approach**:
- @RolesAllowed: Standard approach for most endpoints
- @PermitAll: Explicitly public endpoints (health checks, documentation)
- @DenyAll: Deprecated or disabled endpoints
- Manual check: Custom authentication logic

**Related Issues**:
- CORS configuration for cross-origin requests
- CSRF protection for state-changing operations
- Rate limiting for public APIs

**References**:
- [JAX-RS Security](https://docs.oracle.com/javaee/7/tutorial/security-jaxrs002.htm)
- [Bloomreach REST API Security](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [OWASP API Security Top 10](https://owasp.org/www-project-api-security/)

**Why This Is Dangerous**:
- API endpoints are directly accessible via HTTP

security.rest-authentication Security Issues
Show details 
REST endpoint 'getBuyingGroupUsers' (GET) does not have authentication configured.

**Security Risk**: CRITICAL - Unauthorized access to API endpoints

**Why This Is Dangerous**:
- API endpoints are directly accessible via HTTP
- No authentication means anyone can call the endpoint
- Can expose sensitive data or operations

- May violate compliance requirements (GDPR, HIPAA, etc.)

**Problem Pattern**:
```java
// ❌ PROBLEM - No authentication
@Path("/api/users")
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        // Anyone can access this!
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**Correct Patterns**:

**1. JAX-RS with @RolesAllowed** (Recommended):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    @RolesAllowed({"admin", "user"})  // Add this!
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**2. Spring with @PreAuthorize**:
```java
@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/users")
public class UserController {
    @GetMapping("/{id}")
    @PreAuthorize("hasRole('ADMIN') or hasRole('USER')")  // Add this!
    public User getUser(@PathVariable String id) {
        return userService.getUser(id);
    }
}
```

**3. Class-Level Security** (applies to all methods):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
@RolesAllowed("user")  // Applies to all endpoints
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }

    @POST
    @RolesAllowed("admin")  // Override for specific method
    public Response createUser(User user) {
        return Response.ok(userService.create(user)).build();
    }
}
```

**4. Manual Authentication Check** (when annotations don't work):
```java
@GET
@Path("/{id}")
public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id, @Context SecurityContext sc) {
    // Manual check
    if (sc.getUserPrincipal() == null) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.UNAUTHORIZED).build();
    }

    // Check role
    if (!sc.isUserInRole("user")) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.FORBIDDEN).build();
    }

    return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
}
```

**5. Public Endpoint** (explicitly mark as public):
```java
@GET
@Path("/health")
@PermitAll  // Explicitly mark as public
public Response healthCheck() {
    return Response.ok("OK").build();
}
```

**Common Bloomreach Roles**:
- `admin` - Full administrative access
- `author` - Content authors
- `editor` - Content editors
- `developer` - Developers
- `xm.rest.user` - REST API access
- `xm.rest.admin` - REST API administrative access

**Configuration**:
Ensure authentication is configured in web.xml:
```xml
<security-constraint>
    <web-resource-collection>
        <web-resource-name>REST API</web-resource-name>
        <url-pattern>/api/*</url-pattern>
    </web-resource-collection>
    <auth-constraint>
        <role-name>xm.rest.user</role-name>
    </auth-constraint>
</security-constraint>
```

**Testing**:
```bash
# Test without auth (should fail)
curl http://localhost:8080/api/users/123

# Test with auth
curl -u admin:admin http://localhost:8080/api/users/123
```

**When to Use Each Approach**:
- @RolesAllowed: Standard approach for most endpoints
- @PermitAll: Explicitly public endpoints (health checks, documentation)
- @DenyAll: Deprecated or disabled endpoints
- Manual check: Custom authentication logic

**Related Issues**:
- CORS configuration for cross-origin requests
- CSRF protection for state-changing operations
- Rate limiting for public APIs

**References**:
- [JAX-RS Security](https://docs.oracle.com/javaee/7/tutorial/security-jaxrs002.htm)
- [Bloomreach REST API Security](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [OWASP API Security Top 10](https://owasp.org/www-project-api-security/)
ERROR Line 127:2
REST endpoint 'addBuyingGroupUser' missing authentication
security.rest-authentication Security Issues
Show details 
REST endpoint 'addBuyingGroupUser' (POST) does not have authentication configured.

**Security Risk**: CRITICAL - Unauthorized access to API endpoints

**Why This Is Dangerous**:
- API endpoints are directly accessible via HTTP
- No authentication means anyone can call the endpoint
- Can expose sensitive data or operations
- Common target for automated attacks
- May violate compliance requirements (GDPR, HIPAA, etc.)

**Problem Pattern**:
```java
// ❌ PROBLEM - No authentication
@Path("/api/users")
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        // Anyone can access this!
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**Correct Patterns**:

**1. JAX-RS with @RolesAllowed** (Recommended):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    @RolesAllowed({"admin", "user"})  // Add this!
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**2. Spring with @PreAuthorize**:
```java
@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/users")
public class UserController {
    @GetMapping("/{id}")
    @PreAuthorize("hasRole('ADMIN') or hasRole('USER')")  // Add this!
    public User getUser(@PathVariable String id) {
        return userService.getUser(id);
    }
}
```

**3. Class-Level Security** (applies to all methods):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
@RolesAllowed("user")  // Applies to all endpoints
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }

    @POST
    @RolesAllowed("admin")  // Override for specific method
    public Response createUser(User user) {
        return Response.ok(userService.create(user)).build();
    }
}
```

**4. Manual Authentication Check** (when annotations don't work):
```java
@GET
@Path("/{id}")
public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id, @Context SecurityContext sc) {
    // Manual check
    if (sc.getUserPrincipal() == null) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.UNAUTHORIZED).build();
    }

    // Check role
    if (!sc.isUserInRole("user")) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.FORBIDDEN).build();
    }

    return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
}
```

**5. Public Endpoint** (explicitly mark as public):
```java
@GET
@Path("/health")
@PermitAll  // Explicitly mark as public
public Response healthCheck() {
    return Response.ok("OK").build();
}
```

**Common Bloomreach Roles**:
- `admin` - Full administrative access
- `author` - Content authors
- `editor` - Content editors
- `developer` - Developers
- `xm.rest.user` - REST API access
- `xm.rest.admin` - REST API administrative access

**Configuration**:
Ensure authentication is configured in web.xml:
```xml
<security-constraint>
    <web-resource-collection>
        <web-resource-name>REST API</web-resource-name>
        <url-pattern>/api/*</url-pattern>
    </web-resource-collection>
    <auth-constraint>
        <role-name>xm.rest.user</role-name>
    </auth-constraint>
</security-constraint>
```

**Testing**:
```bash

# Test with auth
curl -u admin:admin http://localhost:8080/api/users/123
```

- @PermitAll: Explicitly public endpoints (health checks, documentation)
- @DenyAll: Deprecated or disabled endpoints
- Manual check: Custom authentication logic

- CSRF protection for state-changing operations

REST endpoint 'getCustomerProfile' missing authentication
security.rest-authentication Security Issues
Show details 
REST endpoint 'getCustomerProfile' (GET) does not have authentication configured.

**Security Risk**: CRITICAL - Unauthorized access to API endpoints

**Why This Is Dangerous**:
- API endpoints are directly accessible via HTTP
- No authentication means anyone can call the endpoint
- Can expose sensitive data or operations

- May violate compliance requirements (GDPR, HIPAA, etc.)

```java

    }
}
```

**Correct Patterns**:

**1. JAX-RS with @RolesAllowed** (Recommended):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    @RolesAllowed({"admin", "user"})  // Add this!
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**2. Spring with @PreAuthorize**:
```java
@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/users")
public class UserController {
    @GetMapping("/{id}")
    @PreAuthorize("hasRole('ADMIN') or hasRole('USER')")  // Add this!
    public User getUser(@PathVariable String id) {
        return userService.getUser(id);
    }
}
```

**3. Class-Level Security** (applies to all methods):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
@RolesAllowed("user")  // Applies to all endpoints
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }

    @POST
    @RolesAllowed("admin")  // Override for specific method
    public Response createUser(User user) {
        return Response.ok(userService.create(user)).build();
    }
}
```

**4. Manual Authentication Check** (when annotations don't work):
```java
@GET
@Path("/{id}")
public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id, @Context SecurityContext sc) {
    // Manual check
    if (sc.getUserPrincipal() == null) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.UNAUTHORIZED).build();
    }

    // Check role
    if (!sc.isUserInRole("user")) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.FORBIDDEN).build();
    }

    return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
}
```

**5. Public Endpoint** (explicitly mark as public):
```java
@GET
@Path("/health")
@PermitAll  // Explicitly mark as public
public Response healthCheck() {
    return Response.ok("OK").build();
}
```

**Common Bloomreach Roles**:
- `admin` - Full administrative access
- `author` - Content authors
- `editor` - Content editors
- `developer` - Developers
- `xm.rest.user` - REST API access
- `xm.rest.admin` - REST API administrative access

**Configuration**:
Ensure authentication is configured in web.xml:
```xml
<security-constraint>
    <web-resource-collection>
        <web-resource-name>REST API</web-resource-name>
        <url-pattern>/api/*</url-pattern>
    </web-resource-collection>
    <auth-constraint>
        <role-name>xm.rest.user</role-name>
    </auth-constraint>
</security-constraint>
```

**Testing**:
```bash
# Test without auth (should fail)
curl http://localhost:8080/api/users/123

# Test with auth
curl -u admin:admin http://localhost:8080/api/users/123
```

**When to Use Each Approach**:
- @RolesAllowed: Standard approach for most endpoints
- @PermitAll: Explicitly public endpoints (health checks, documentation)
- @DenyAll: Deprecated or disabled endpoints
- Manual check: Custom authentication logic

**Related Issues**:
- CORS configuration for cross-origin requests
- CSRF protection for state-changing operations
- Rate limiting for public APIs

**References**:
- [JAX-RS Security](https://docs.oracle.com/javaee/7/tutorial/security-jaxrs002.htm)
- [Bloomreach REST API Security](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [OWASP API Security Top 10](https://owasp.org/www-project-api-security/)
ERROR Line 152:5
REST endpoint 'updateSuperuser' missing authentication
security.rest-authentication Security Issues
Show details 
REST endpoint 'updateSuperuser' (GET) does not have authentication configured.

**Security Risk**: CRITICAL - Unauthorized access to API endpoints

**Why This Is Dangerous**:
- API endpoints are directly accessible via HTTP
- No authentication means anyone can call the endpoint
- Can expose sensitive data or operations
- Common target for automated attacks
- May violate compliance requirements (GDPR, HIPAA, etc.)

**Problem Pattern**:
```java
// ❌ PROBLEM - No authentication
@Path("/api/users")
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        // Anyone can access this!
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**Correct Patterns**:

**1. JAX-RS with @RolesAllowed** (Recommended):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    @RolesAllowed({"admin", "user"})  // Add this!
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**2. Spring with @PreAuthorize**:
```java
@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/users")
public class UserController {
    @GetMapping("/{id}")
    @PreAuthorize("hasRole('ADMIN') or hasRole('USER')")  // Add this!
    public User getUser(@PathVariable String id) {
        return userService.getUser(id);
    }
}
```

**3. Class-Level Security** (applies to all methods):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
@RolesAllowed("user")  // Applies to all endpoints
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }

    @POST
    @RolesAllowed("admin")  // Override for specific method
    public Response createUser(User user) {
        return Response.ok(userService.create(user)).build();
    }
}
```

**4. Manual Authentication Check** (when annotations don't work):
```java
@GET
@Path("/{id}")
public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id, @Context SecurityContext sc) {
    // Manual check
    if (sc.getUserPrincipal() == null) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.UNAUTHORIZED).build();
    }

    // Check role
    if (!sc.isUserInRole("user")) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.FORBIDDEN).build();
    }

    return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
}
```

**5. Public Endpoint** (explicitly mark as public):
```java
@GET
@Path("/health")
@PermitAll  // Explicitly mark as public
public Response healthCheck() {
    return Response.ok("OK").build();
}
```

**Common Bloomreach Roles**:
- `admin` - Full administrative access
- `author` - Content authors
- `editor` - Content editors
- `developer` - Developers
- `xm.rest.user` - REST API access
- `xm.rest.admin` - REST API administrative access

**Configuration**:
Ensure authentication is configured in web.xml:
```xml
<security-constraint>
    <web-resource-collection>
        <web-resource-name>REST API</web-resource-name>
        <url-pattern>/api/*</url-pattern>
    </web-resource-collection>
    <auth-constraint>
        <role-name>xm.rest.user</role-name>
    </auth-constraint>
</security-constraint>
```

```bash

# Test with auth
curl -u admin:admin http://localhost:8080/api/users/123
```

- @DenyAll: Deprecated or disabled endpoints
- Manual check: Custom authentication logic

**Why This Is Dangerous**:
- API endpoints are directly accessible via HTTP
- No authentication means anyone can call the endpoint
- Can expose sensitive data or operations

```java
    @RolesAllowed({"admin", "user"})  // Add this!
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**2. Spring with @PreAuthorize**:
```java
@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/users")
public class UserController {
    @GetMapping("/{id}")
    @PreAuthorize("hasRole('ADMIN') or hasRole('USER')")  // Add this!
    public User getUser(@PathVariable String id) {
        return userService.getUser(id);
    }
}
```

**3. Class-Level Security** (applies to all methods):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
@RolesAllowed("user")  // Applies to all endpoints
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }

    @POST
    @RolesAllowed("admin")  // Override for specific method
    public Response createUser(User user) {
        return Response.ok(userService.create(user)).build();
    }
}
```

**4. Manual Authentication Check** (when annotations don't work):
```java
@GET
@Path("/{id}")
public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id, @Context SecurityContext sc) {
    // Manual check
    if (sc.getUserPrincipal() == null) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.UNAUTHORIZED).build();
    }

    // Check role
    if (!sc.isUserInRole("user")) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.FORBIDDEN).build();
    }

    return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
}
```

**5. Public Endpoint** (explicitly mark as public):
```java
@GET
@Path("/health")
@PermitAll  // Explicitly mark as public
public Response healthCheck() {
    return Response.ok("OK").build();
}
```

**Common Bloomreach Roles**:
- `admin` - Full administrative access
- `author` - Content authors
- `editor` - Content editors
- `developer` - Developers
- `xm.rest.user` - REST API access
- `xm.rest.admin` - REST API administrative access

**Configuration**:
Ensure authentication is configured in web.xml:
```xml
<security-constraint>
    <web-resource-collection>
        <web-resource-name>REST API</web-resource-name>
        <url-pattern>/api/*</url-pattern>
    </web-resource-collection>
    <auth-constraint>
        <role-name>xm.rest.user</role-name>
    </auth-constraint>
</security-constraint>
```

**Testing**:
```bash
# Test without auth (should fail)
curl http://localhost:8080/api/users/123

# Test with auth
curl -u admin:admin http://localhost:8080/api/users/123
```

**When to Use Each Approach**:
- @RolesAllowed: Standard approach for most endpoints
- @PermitAll: Explicitly public endpoints (health checks, documentation)
- @DenyAll: Deprecated or disabled endpoints
- Manual check: Custom authentication logic

**Related Issues**:
- CORS configuration for cross-origin requests
- CSRF protection for state-changing operations
- Rate limiting for public APIs

**References**:
- [JAX-RS Security](https://docs.oracle.com/javaee/7/tutorial/security-jaxrs002.htm)
- [Bloomreach REST API Security](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [OWASP API Security Top 10](https://owasp.org/www-project-api-security/)
ERROR Line 341:5
REST endpoint 'getStoreGroupPos' missing authentication
security.rest-authentication Security Issues
Show details 
REST endpoint 'getStoreGroupPos' (GET) does not have authentication configured.

**Security Risk**: CRITICAL - Unauthorized access to API endpoints

**Why This Is Dangerous**:
- API endpoints are directly accessible via HTTP
- No authentication means anyone can call the endpoint
- Can expose sensitive data or operations
- Common target for automated attacks
- May violate compliance requirements (GDPR, HIPAA, etc.)

**Problem Pattern**:
```java
// ❌ PROBLEM - No authentication
@Path("/api/users")
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        // Anyone can access this!
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**Correct Patterns**:

**1. JAX-RS with @RolesAllowed** (Recommended):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    @RolesAllowed({"admin", "user"})  // Add this!
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }
}
```

**2. Spring with @PreAuthorize**:
```java
@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/users")
public class UserController {
    @GetMapping("/{id}")
    @PreAuthorize("hasRole('ADMIN') or hasRole('USER')")  // Add this!
    public User getUser(@PathVariable String id) {
        return userService.getUser(id);
    }
}
```

**3. Class-Level Security** (applies to all methods):
```java
@Path("/api/users")
@RolesAllowed("user")  // Applies to all endpoints
public class UserResource {
    @GET
    @Path("/{id}")
    public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id) {
        return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
    }

    @POST
    @RolesAllowed("admin")  // Override for specific method
    public Response createUser(User user) {
        return Response.ok(userService.create(user)).build();
    }
}
```

**4. Manual Authentication Check** (when annotations don't work):
```java
@GET
@Path("/{id}")
public Response getUser(@PathParam("id") String id, @Context SecurityContext sc) {
    // Manual check
    if (sc.getUserPrincipal() == null) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.UNAUTHORIZED).build();
    }

    // Check role
    if (!sc.isUserInRole("user")) {
        return Response.status(Response.Status.FORBIDDEN).build();
    }

    return Response.ok(userService.getUser(id)).build();
}
```

**5. Public Endpoint** (explicitly mark as public):
```java
@GET
@Path("/health")
@PermitAll  // Explicitly mark as public
public Response healthCheck() {
    return Response.ok("OK").build();
}
```

**Common Bloomreach Roles**:
- `admin` - Full administrative access
- `author` - Content authors
- `editor` - Content editors
- `developer` - Developers
- `xm.rest.user` - REST API access
- `xm.rest.admin` - REST API administrative access

**Configuration**:
Ensure authentication is configured in web.xml:
```xml
<security-constraint>
    <web-resource-collection>
        <web-resource-name>REST API</web-resource-name>
        <url-pattern>/api/*</url-pattern>
    </web-resource-collection>
    <auth-constraint>
        <role-name>xm.rest.user</role-name>
    </auth-constraint>
</security-constraint>
```

```bash

# Test with auth
```

- @DenyAll: Deprecated or disabled endpoints
