Show details 
The component parameter 'INVOICE_NUMBER_PARAM_NAME' is accessed via getParameter()
and stored in variable 'invoiceNumber', but used without null checking.

**Risk**: HIGH - NullPointerException if parameter not configured

**Why This Happens**:
- Parameter not configured in CMS UI
- Typo in parameter name
- Component used in different context without configuration
- Configuration not published yet
- Parameter removed during refactoring

**Problem Pattern**:
```java
// ⚠️ PROBLEM - No null check
String value = getParameter("myParam");
result.setText(value.toUpperCase()); // NPE if value is null!
```

**Correct Patterns**:

**1. Simple Null Check** (Recommended):
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
if (value != null) {
    result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
} else {
    // Provide default or skip
    result.setText("Default Value");
}
```

**2. Early Return**:
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
if (value == null) {
    logger.warn("Parameter 'myParam' not configured");
    return;
}
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**3. Default Value**:
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
String safeValue = (value != null) ? value : "defaultValue";
result.setText(safeValue.toUpperCase());
```

**4. Optional Pattern** (Modern Java):
```java
Optional.ofNullable(getParameter("myParam"))
    .map(String::toUpperCase)
    .ifPresent(result::setText);
```

**5. Apache Commons** (if available):
```java
String value = StringUtils.defaultString(getParameter("myParam"), "default");
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**Best Practices**:
- Document required parameters in component class JavaDoc
- Log warnings when required parameters are missing
- Provide sensible defaults where possible
- Use parameter validation in doBeforeRender()
- Consider creating a ParametersInfo class with validated parameters

**Example: Robust Parameter Handling**:
```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;
    }

    // Optional parameter with default
    int maxItems = 10;
    if (limit != null) {
        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

**Common HST Parameters to Check**:
- Document picker paths
- Query parameters
- Display settings (limit, offset)
- Configuration flags
- Custom component settings

**Related Community Issues**:
- NullPointerException in component rendering
- "Component not displaying" (due to NPE in doBeforeRender)
- Parameters working locally but not on server

**HST Component Configuration**:
Component parameters are configured in repository at:
```
/hst:hst/hst:configurations/[project]/hst:components/[component]
  + hst:parameternames = ['param1', 'param2']
  + hst:parametervalues = ['value1', 'value2']
```

**References**:
- [HST Component Development](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [Component Parameters Guide](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
WARNING Line 93:45
Parameter 'GENERATION_ID_PARAM_NAME' used without null check
config.component-parameter-null Configuration Problems
Show details 
The component parameter 'GENERATION_ID_PARAM_NAME' is accessed via getParameter()
and stored in variable 'generationId', but used without null checking.

**Risk**: HIGH - NullPointerException if parameter not configured

**Why This Happens**:
- Parameter not configured in CMS UI
- Typo in parameter name
- Component used in different context without configuration
- Configuration not published yet
- Parameter removed during refactoring

**Problem Pattern**:
```java
// ⚠️ PROBLEM - No null check
String value = getParameter("myParam");
result.setText(value.toUpperCase()); // NPE if value is null!
```

**Correct Patterns**:

**1. Simple Null Check** (Recommended):
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
if (value != null) {
    result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
} else {
    // Provide default or skip
    result.setText("Default Value");
}
```

**2. Early Return**:
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
if (value == null) {
    logger.warn("Parameter 'myParam' not configured");
    return;
}
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**3. Default Value**:
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
String safeValue = (value != null) ? value : "defaultValue";
result.setText(safeValue.toUpperCase());
```

**4. Optional Pattern** (Modern Java):
```java

    .map(String::toUpperCase)
    .ifPresent(result::setText);
```

**5. Apache Commons** (if available):
```java

result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**Best Practices**:
- Document required parameters in component class JavaDoc
- Log warnings when required parameters are missing
- Provide sensible defaults where possible
- Use parameter validation in doBeforeRender()
- Consider creating a ParametersInfo class with validated parameters

**Example: Robust Parameter Handling**:
```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;
    }

    // Optional parameter with default
    int maxItems = 10;
    if (limit != null) {
        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

- Query parameters
- Display settings (limit, offset)
- Configuration flags

```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;

            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

**Example: Robust Parameter Handling**:
```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;
    }

    // Optional parameter with default
    int maxItems = 10;
    if (limit != null) {
        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

7 issue(s)
ERROR Line 73:45
Parameter 'START_DATE_PARAM_NAME' used inline without null check
config.component-parameter-null Configuration Problems
Show details 
The component parameter 'START_DATE_PARAM_NAME' is accessed and used immediately
without any null checking. This will cause a NullPointerException if the
parameter is not configured.

**Problem**: Inline usage without assignment makes it impossible to null-check

**Example**:
```java
// ❌ PROBLEM - Inline usage
result.setText(getParameter("title").toUpperCase());
// NPE if 'title' parameter not configured!
```

**Solution**: Assign to variable first, then null-check:
```java
String title = getParameter("title");
if (title != null) {
    result.setText(title.toUpperCase());
} else {
    result.setText("Untitled");
}
```

See the main documentation for comprehensive examples and best practices.
ERROR Line 74:43
Parameter 'END_DATE_PARAM_NAME' used inline without null check
config.component-parameter-null Configuration Problems
Show details 
The component parameter 'END_DATE_PARAM_NAME' is accessed and used immediately
without any null checking. This will cause a NullPointerException if the
parameter is not configured.

**Problem**: Inline usage without assignment makes it impossible to null-check

**Example**:
```java

// NPE if 'title' parameter not configured!
```

```java
    result.setText(title.toUpperCase());
} else {
    result.setText("Untitled");
}
```

```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;
    }

    // Optional parameter with default
    int maxItems = 10;
    if (limit != null) {
        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

```java
    String title = getParameter("title");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
```

```java
}
```

**2. Early Return**:
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
if (value == null) {
    logger.warn("Parameter 'myParam' not configured");
    return;
}
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**3. Default Value**:
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
String safeValue = (value != null) ? value : "defaultValue";
result.setText(safeValue.toUpperCase());
```

**4. Optional Pattern** (Modern Java):
```java
Optional.ofNullable(getParameter("myParam"))
    .map(String::toUpperCase)
    .ifPresent(result::setText);
```

**5. Apache Commons** (if available):
```java
String value = StringUtils.defaultString(getParameter("myParam"), "default");
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**Best Practices**:
- Document required parameters in component class JavaDoc
- Log warnings when required parameters are missing
- Provide sensible defaults where possible
- Use parameter validation in doBeforeRender()
- Consider creating a ParametersInfo class with validated parameters

**Example: Robust Parameter Handling**:
```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;
    }

    // Optional parameter with default
    int maxItems = 10;
    if (limit != null) {
        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

**Common HST Parameters to Check**:
- Document picker paths
- Query parameters
- Display settings (limit, offset)
- Configuration flags
- Custom component settings

**Related Community Issues**:
- NullPointerException in component rendering
- "Component not displaying" (due to NPE in doBeforeRender)
- Parameters working locally but not on server

**HST Component Configuration**:
Component parameters are configured in repository at:
```
/hst:hst/hst:configurations/[project]/hst:components/[component]
  + hst:parameternames = ['param1', 'param2']
  + hst:parametervalues = ['value1', 'value2']
```

**References**:
- [HST Component Development](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [Component Parameters Guide](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
WARNING Line 113:41
Parameter 'SEARCH_STRING_PARAM_NAME' used without null check
config.component-parameter-null Configuration Problems
Show details 
The component parameter 'SEARCH_STRING_PARAM_NAME' is accessed via getParameter()
and stored in variable 'searchString', but used without null checking.

**Risk**: HIGH - NullPointerException if parameter not configured

**Why This Happens**:
- Parameter not configured in CMS UI
- Typo in parameter name
- Component used in different context without configuration
- Configuration not published yet
- Parameter removed during refactoring

**Problem Pattern**:
```java
// ⚠️ PROBLEM - No null check
String value = getParameter("myParam");
result.setText(value.toUpperCase()); // NPE if value is null!
```

**Correct Patterns**:

**1. Simple Null Check** (Recommended):
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
if (value != null) {
    result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
} else {
    // Provide default or skip
    result.setText("Default Value");
}
```

**2. Early Return**:
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
if (value == null) {
    logger.warn("Parameter 'myParam' not configured");
    return;
}
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**3. Default Value**:
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
String safeValue = (value != null) ? value : "defaultValue";
result.setText(safeValue.toUpperCase());
```

**4. Optional Pattern** (Modern Java):
```java
Optional.ofNullable(getParameter("myParam"))
    .map(String::toUpperCase)
    .ifPresent(result::setText);
```

**5. Apache Commons** (if available):
```java
String value = StringUtils.defaultString(getParameter("myParam"), "default");
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**Best Practices**:
- Document required parameters in component class JavaDoc
- Log warnings when required parameters are missing
- Provide sensible defaults where possible
- Use parameter validation in doBeforeRender()
- Consider creating a ParametersInfo class with validated parameters

**Example: Robust Parameter Handling**:
```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;
    }

    // Optional parameter with default
    int maxItems = 10;
    if (limit != null) {
        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

**Common HST Parameters to Check**:
- Document picker paths
- Query parameters
- Display settings (limit, offset)
- Configuration flags
- Custom component settings

**Related Community Issues**:
- NullPointerException in component rendering
- "Component not displaying" (due to NPE in doBeforeRender)
- Parameters working locally but not on server

**HST Component Configuration**:
Component parameters are configured in repository at:
```
/hst:hst/hst:configurations/[project]/hst:components/[component]
  + hst:parameternames = ['param1', 'param2']
  + hst:parametervalues = ['value1', 'value2']
```

- [Component Parameters Guide](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)

```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;
    }

    // Optional parameter with default
    int maxItems = 10;
    if (limit != null) {
        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;
    }

    // Optional parameter with default
    int maxItems = 10;
    if (limit != null) {
        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

```java
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
```

- Parameters working locally but not on server

**HST Component Configuration**:
Component parameters are configured in repository at:
```
/hst:hst/hst:configurations/[project]/hst:components/[component]
  + hst:parameternames = ['param1', 'param2']
  + hst:parametervalues = ['value1', 'value2']
```

**References**:
- [HST Component Development](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [Component Parameters Guide](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
WARNING Line 90:43
Parameter 'excludeFromEnhancedWillCall" + i' used without null check
config.component-parameter-null Configuration Problems
Show details 
The component parameter 'excludeFromEnhancedWillCall" + i' is accessed via getParameter()
and stored in variable 'excludeFromValue', but used without null checking.

**Risk**: HIGH - NullPointerException if parameter not configured

**Why This Happens**:
- Parameter not configured in CMS UI
- Typo in parameter name
- Component used in different context without configuration
- Configuration not published yet
- Parameter removed during refactoring

**Problem Pattern**:
```java
// ⚠️ PROBLEM - No null check
String value = getParameter("myParam");
result.setText(value.toUpperCase()); // NPE if value is null!
```

**Correct Patterns**:

**1. Simple Null Check** (Recommended):
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
if (value != null) {
    result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
} else {
    // Provide default or skip
    result.setText("Default Value");
}
```

**2. Early Return**:
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
if (value == null) {
    logger.warn("Parameter 'myParam' not configured");
    return;
}
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**3. Default Value**:
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
String safeValue = (value != null) ? value : "defaultValue";
result.setText(safeValue.toUpperCase());
```

**4. Optional Pattern** (Modern Java):
```java
Optional.ofNullable(getParameter("myParam"))
    .map(String::toUpperCase)
    .ifPresent(result::setText);
```

**5. Apache Commons** (if available):
```java
String value = StringUtils.defaultString(getParameter("myParam"), "default");
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**Best Practices**:
- Document required parameters in component class JavaDoc
- Log warnings when required parameters are missing
- Provide sensible defaults where possible
- Use parameter validation in doBeforeRender()
- Consider creating a ParametersInfo class with validated parameters

**Example: Robust Parameter Handling**:
```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;
    }

    // Optional parameter with default
    int maxItems = 10;
    if (limit != null) {
        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

**Common HST Parameters to Check**:
- Document picker paths
- Query parameters
- Display settings (limit, offset)
- Configuration flags
- Custom component settings

**Related Community Issues**:
- NullPointerException in component rendering
- "Component not displaying" (due to NPE in doBeforeRender)
- Parameters working locally but not on server

**HST Component Configuration**:
Component parameters are configured in repository at:
```
/hst:hst/hst:configurations/[project]/hst:components/[component]
  + hst:parameternames = ['param1', 'param2']
  + hst:parametervalues = ['value1', 'value2']
```

**References**:
- [HST Component Development](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [Component Parameters Guide](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)

../johnstone-bloomreach-v14--latest-code/johnstonesupply-cms/site/components/src/main/java/com/johnstonesupply/cms/components/scm/storemanager/productlists/Home.java

13 issue(s)
WARNING Line 74:19
Parameter 'request' used without null check
config.component-parameter-null Configuration Problems
Show details 
The component parameter 'request' is accessed via getPublicRequestParameter()
and stored in variable 'action', but used without null checking.

**Risk**: HIGH - NullPointerException if parameter not configured

**Why This Happens**:
- Parameter not configured in CMS UI
- Typo in parameter name
- Component used in different context without configuration
- Configuration not published yet
- Parameter removed during refactoring

**Problem Pattern**:
```java

result.setText(value.toUpperCase()); // NPE if value is null!
```

**Correct Patterns**:

**1. Simple Null Check** (Recommended):
```java

    result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
} else {
    // Provide default or skip
    result.setText("Default Value");
}
```

**2. Early Return**:
```java

    logger.warn("Parameter 'myParam' not configured");
    return;
}
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**3. Default Value**:
```java

    .ifPresent(result::setText);
```

**5. Apache Commons** (if available):
```java

result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

- Document required parameters in component class JavaDoc
- Log warnings when required parameters are missing
- Provide sensible defaults where possible
- Use parameter validation in doBeforeRender()
- Consider creating a ParametersInfo class with validated parameters

**Example: Robust Parameter Handling**:
```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;
    }

    // Optional parameter with default
    int maxItems = 10;
    if (limit != null) {
        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;

        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

```java
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters

        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
```

```java
@Override
```

```java
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;
    }

    // Optional parameter with default
    int maxItems = 10;
    if (limit != null) {
        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

**Common HST Parameters to Check**:
- Document picker paths
- Query parameters
- Display settings (limit, offset)
- Configuration flags
- Custom component settings

**Related Community Issues**:
- NullPointerException in component rendering
- "Component not displaying" (due to NPE in doBeforeRender)
- Parameters working locally but not on server

**HST Component Configuration**:
Component parameters are configured in repository at:
```
/hst:hst/hst:configurations/[project]/hst:components/[component]
  + hst:parameternames = ['param1', 'param2']
  + hst:parametervalues = ['value1', 'value2']
```

**References**:
- [HST Component Development](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [Component Parameters Guide](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
WARNING Line 204:28
Parameter 'request' used without null check
config.component-parameter-null Configuration Problems
Show details 
The component parameter 'request' is accessed via getPublicRequestParameter()
and stored in variable 'listDescription', but used without null checking.

**Risk**: HIGH - NullPointerException if parameter not configured

**Why This Happens**:
- Parameter not configured in CMS UI
- Typo in parameter name
- Component used in different context without configuration
- Configuration not published yet
- Parameter removed during refactoring

**Problem Pattern**:
```java
// ⚠️ PROBLEM - No null check
String value = getParameter("myParam");
result.setText(value.toUpperCase()); // NPE if value is null!
```

**Correct Patterns**:

**1. Simple Null Check** (Recommended):
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
if (value != null) {
    result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
} else {
    // Provide default or skip
    result.setText("Default Value");
}
```

**2. Early Return**:
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
if (value == null) {
    logger.warn("Parameter 'myParam' not configured");
    return;
}
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**3. Default Value**:
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
String safeValue = (value != null) ? value : "defaultValue";
result.setText(safeValue.toUpperCase());
```

**4. Optional Pattern** (Modern Java):
```java
Optional.ofNullable(getParameter("myParam"))
    .map(String::toUpperCase)
    .ifPresent(result::setText);
```

**5. Apache Commons** (if available):
```java
String value = StringUtils.defaultString(getParameter("myParam"), "default");
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**Best Practices**:
- Document required parameters in component class JavaDoc
- Log warnings when required parameters are missing
- Provide sensible defaults where possible
- Use parameter validation in doBeforeRender()
- Consider creating a ParametersInfo class with validated parameters

**Example: Robust Parameter Handling**:
```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;
    }

    // Optional parameter with default
    int maxItems = 10;
    if (limit != null) {
        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

**Common HST Parameters to Check**:
- Document picker paths
- Query parameters
- Display settings (limit, offset)
- Configuration flags
- Custom component settings

**Related Community Issues**:
- NullPointerException in component rendering
- "Component not displaying" (due to NPE in doBeforeRender)
- Parameters working locally but not on server

**HST Component Configuration**:
Component parameters are configured in repository at:
```
/hst:hst/hst:configurations/[project]/hst:components/[component]
  + hst:parameternames = ['param1', 'param2']
  + hst:parametervalues = ['value1', 'value2']
```

**References**:
- [HST Component Development](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [Component Parameters Guide](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)

Parameter 'request' used without null check
config.component-parameter-null Configuration Problems
Show details 
The component parameter 'request' is accessed via getPublicRequestParameter()
and stored in variable 'storeCode', but used without null checking.

**Risk**: HIGH - NullPointerException if parameter not configured

**Why This Happens**:
- Parameter not configured in CMS UI
- Typo in parameter name
- Component used in different context without configuration
- Configuration not published yet
- Parameter removed during refactoring

```java

} else {
    // Provide default or skip
    result.setText("Default Value");
}
```

```java
    return;
```

```java

    .map(String::toUpperCase)
    .ifPresent(result::setText);
```

```java

result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**Best Practices**:

- Log warnings when required parameters are missing
- Provide sensible defaults where possible
- Use parameter validation in doBeforeRender()
- Consider creating a ParametersInfo class with validated parameters

**Example: Robust Parameter Handling**:
```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;
    }

    // Optional parameter with default
    int maxItems = 10;
    if (limit != null) {
        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;
    }

    // Optional parameter with default
    int maxItems = 10;
    if (limit != null) {
        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

```java
    String limit = getParameter("limit");
```

```java
}
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**3. Default Value**:
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
String safeValue = (value != null) ? value : "defaultValue";
result.setText(safeValue.toUpperCase());
```

**4. Optional Pattern** (Modern Java):
```java
Optional.ofNullable(getParameter("myParam"))
    .map(String::toUpperCase)
    .ifPresent(result::setText);
```

**5. Apache Commons** (if available):
```java
String value = StringUtils.defaultString(getParameter("myParam"), "default");
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**Best Practices**:
- Document required parameters in component class JavaDoc
- Log warnings when required parameters are missing
- Provide sensible defaults where possible
- Use parameter validation in doBeforeRender()
- Consider creating a ParametersInfo class with validated parameters

**Example: Robust Parameter Handling**:
```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;
    }

    // Optional parameter with default
    int maxItems = 10;
    if (limit != null) {
        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

**Common HST Parameters to Check**:
- Document picker paths
- Query parameters
- Display settings (limit, offset)
- Configuration flags
- Custom component settings

**Related Community Issues**:
- NullPointerException in component rendering
- "Component not displaying" (due to NPE in doBeforeRender)
- Parameters working locally but not on server

**HST Component Configuration**:
Component parameters are configured in repository at:
```
/hst:hst/hst:configurations/[project]/hst:components/[component]
  + hst:parameternames = ['param1', 'param2']
  + hst:parametervalues = ['value1', 'value2']
```

**References**:
- [HST Component Development](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [Component Parameters Guide](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
WARNING Line 78:23
Parameter 'request' used without null check
config.component-parameter-null Configuration Problems
Show details 
The component parameter 'request' is accessed via getPublicRequestParameter()
and stored in variable 'storeCode', but used without null checking.

**Risk**: HIGH - NullPointerException if parameter not configured

**Why This Happens**:
- Parameter not configured in CMS UI
- Typo in parameter name
- Component used in different context without configuration
- Configuration not published yet
- Parameter removed during refactoring

**Problem Pattern**:
```java
// ⚠️ PROBLEM - No null check
String value = getParameter("myParam");
result.setText(value.toUpperCase()); // NPE if value is null!
```

**Correct Patterns**:

**1. Simple Null Check** (Recommended):
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
if (value != null) {
    result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
} else {
    // Provide default or skip
    result.setText("Default Value");
}
```

**2. Early Return**:
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
if (value == null) {
    logger.warn("Parameter 'myParam' not configured");
    return;
}
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**3. Default Value**:
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
String safeValue = (value != null) ? value : "defaultValue";
result.setText(safeValue.toUpperCase());
```

**4. Optional Pattern** (Modern Java):
```java
Optional.ofNullable(getParameter("myParam"))
    .map(String::toUpperCase)
    .ifPresent(result::setText);
```

**5. Apache Commons** (if available):
```java
String value = StringUtils.defaultString(getParameter("myParam"), "default");
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**Best Practices**:
- Document required parameters in component class JavaDoc
- Log warnings when required parameters are missing
- Provide sensible defaults where possible
- Use parameter validation in doBeforeRender()
- Consider creating a ParametersInfo class with validated parameters

**Example: Robust Parameter Handling**:
```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;
    }

    // Optional parameter with default
    int maxItems = 10;
    if (limit != null) {
        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

**Common HST Parameters to Check**:
- Document picker paths
- Query parameters
- Display settings (limit, offset)
- Configuration flags
- Custom component settings

**Related Community Issues**:
- NullPointerException in component rendering
- "Component not displaying" (due to NPE in doBeforeRender)
- Parameters working locally but not on server

**HST Component Configuration**:
Component parameters are configured in repository at:
```
/hst:hst/hst:configurations/[project]/hst:components/[component]
  + hst:parameternames = ['param1', 'param2']
  + hst:parametervalues = ['value1', 'value2']
```

- [Component Parameters Guide](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)

- Configuration not published yet
- Parameter removed during refactoring

**Problem Pattern**:
```java
// ⚠️ PROBLEM - No null check
String value = getParameter("myParam");
result.setText(value.toUpperCase()); // NPE if value is null!
```

**Correct Patterns**:

**1. Simple Null Check** (Recommended):
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
if (value != null) {
    result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
} else {
    // Provide default or skip
    result.setText("Default Value");
}
```

**2. Early Return**:
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
if (value == null) {
    logger.warn("Parameter 'myParam' not configured");
    return;
}
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**3. Default Value**:
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
String safeValue = (value != null) ? value : "defaultValue";
result.setText(safeValue.toUpperCase());
```

**4. Optional Pattern** (Modern Java):
```java
Optional.ofNullable(getParameter("myParam"))
    .map(String::toUpperCase)
    .ifPresent(result::setText);
```

**5. Apache Commons** (if available):
```java
String value = StringUtils.defaultString(getParameter("myParam"), "default");
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**Best Practices**:
- Document required parameters in component class JavaDoc
- Log warnings when required parameters are missing
- Provide sensible defaults where possible
- Use parameter validation in doBeforeRender()
- Consider creating a ParametersInfo class with validated parameters

**Example: Robust Parameter Handling**:
```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;
    }

    // Optional parameter with default
    int maxItems = 10;
    if (limit != null) {
        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

**Common HST Parameters to Check**:
- Document picker paths
- Query parameters
- Display settings (limit, offset)
- Configuration flags
- Custom component settings

**Related Community Issues**:
- NullPointerException in component rendering
- "Component not displaying" (due to NPE in doBeforeRender)
- Parameters working locally but not on server

**HST Component Configuration**:
Component parameters are configured in repository at:
```
/hst:hst/hst:configurations/[project]/hst:components/[component]
  + hst:parameternames = ['param1', 'param2']
  + hst:parametervalues = ['value1', 'value2']
```

**References**:
- [HST Component Development](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [Component Parameters Guide](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
WARNING Line 171:19
Parameter 'request' used without null check
config.component-parameter-null Configuration Problems
Show details 
The component parameter 'request' is accessed via getPublicRequestParameter()
and stored in variable 'listId', but used without null checking.

**Risk**: HIGH - NullPointerException if parameter not configured

**Why This Happens**:
- Parameter not configured in CMS UI
- Typo in parameter name
- Component used in different context without configuration
- Configuration not published yet
- Parameter removed during refactoring

**Problem Pattern**:
```java
// ⚠️ PROBLEM - No null check
String value = getParameter("myParam");
result.setText(value.toUpperCase()); // NPE if value is null!
```

**Correct Patterns**:

**1. Simple Null Check** (Recommended):
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
if (value != null) {
    result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
} else {
    // Provide default or skip
    result.setText("Default Value");
}
```

**2. Early Return**:
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
if (value == null) {
    logger.warn("Parameter 'myParam' not configured");
    return;
}
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**3. Default Value**:
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
String safeValue = (value != null) ? value : "defaultValue";
result.setText(safeValue.toUpperCase());
```

**4. Optional Pattern** (Modern Java):
```java
Optional.ofNullable(getParameter("myParam"))
    .map(String::toUpperCase)
    .ifPresent(result::setText);
```

**5. Apache Commons** (if available):
```java
String value = StringUtils.defaultString(getParameter("myParam"), "default");
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**Best Practices**:
- Document required parameters in component class JavaDoc
- Log warnings when required parameters are missing
- Provide sensible defaults where possible
- Use parameter validation in doBeforeRender()
- Consider creating a ParametersInfo class with validated parameters

**Example: Robust Parameter Handling**:
```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;
    }

    // Optional parameter with default
    int maxItems = 10;
    if (limit != null) {
        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

- Document picker paths
- Query parameters
- Display settings (limit, offset)
- Configuration flags
- Custom component settings

- "Component not displaying" (due to NPE in doBeforeRender)
- Parameters working locally but not on server

```
/hst:hst/hst:configurations/[project]/hst:components/[component]
  + hst:parameternames = ['param1', 'param2']
  + hst:parametervalues = ['value1', 'value2']
```

WARNING Line 172:22
Parameter 'request' used without null check
config.component-parameter-null Configuration Problems
Show details 
The component parameter 'request' is accessed via getPublicRequestParameter()
and stored in variable 'storeCode', but used without null checking.

**Risk**: HIGH - NullPointerException if parameter not configured

**Why This Happens**:
- Parameter not configured in CMS UI
- Typo in parameter name
- Component used in different context without configuration
- Configuration not published yet
- Parameter removed during refactoring

```java
}
```

```java
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());

        return;

        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;

        }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
```

```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
```

ERROR Line 58:45
Parameter 'request' used inline without null check
config.component-parameter-null Configuration Problems
Show details 
The component parameter 'request' is accessed and used immediately
without any null checking. This will cause a NullPointerException if the
parameter is not configured.

**Problem**: Inline usage without assignment makes it impossible to null-check

**Example**:
```java
// ❌ PROBLEM - Inline usage
result.setText(getParameter("title").toUpperCase());
// NPE if 'title' parameter not configured!
```

**Solution**: Assign to variable first, then null-check:
```java
String title = getParameter("title");
if (title != null) {
    result.setText(title.toUpperCase());
} else {
    result.setText("Untitled");
}
```

See the main documentation for comprehensive examples and best practices.

../johnstone-bloomreach-v14--latest-code/johnstonesupply-cms/site/components/src/main/java/com/johnstonesupply/cms/components/scm/storemanager/links/Add.java

```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;

        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
```

- Log warnings when required parameters are missing
- Provide sensible defaults where possible
- Use parameter validation in doBeforeRender()
- Consider creating a ParametersInfo class with validated parameters

**Example: Robust Parameter Handling**:
```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;
    }

    // Optional parameter with default
    int maxItems = 10;
    if (limit != null) {
        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

**Common HST Parameters to Check**:
- Document picker paths
- Query parameters
- Display settings (limit, offset)
- Configuration flags
- Custom component settings

**Related Community Issues**:
- NullPointerException in component rendering
- "Component not displaying" (due to NPE in doBeforeRender)
- Parameters working locally but not on server

**HST Component Configuration**:
Component parameters are configured in repository at:
```
/hst:hst/hst:configurations/[project]/hst:components/[component]
  + hst:parameternames = ['param1', 'param2']
  + hst:parametervalues = ['value1', 'value2']
```

**References**:
- [HST Component Development](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [Component Parameters Guide](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
WARNING Line 63:28
Parameter 'request' used without null check
config.component-parameter-null Configuration Problems
Show details 
The component parameter 'request' is accessed via getPublicRequestParameter()
and stored in variable 'storeCode', but used without null checking.

**Risk**: HIGH - NullPointerException if parameter not configured

**Why This Happens**:
- Parameter not configured in CMS UI
- Typo in parameter name
- Component used in different context without configuration
- Configuration not published yet
- Parameter removed during refactoring

**Problem Pattern**:
```java
// ⚠️ PROBLEM - No null check
String value = getParameter("myParam");
result.setText(value.toUpperCase()); // NPE if value is null!
```

**Correct Patterns**:

**1. Simple Null Check** (Recommended):
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
if (value != null) {
    result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
} else {
    // Provide default or skip
    result.setText("Default Value");
}
```

**2. Early Return**:
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
if (value == null) {
    logger.warn("Parameter 'myParam' not configured");
    return;
}
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**3. Default Value**:
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
String safeValue = (value != null) ? value : "defaultValue";
result.setText(safeValue.toUpperCase());
```

**4. Optional Pattern** (Modern Java):
```java
Optional.ofNullable(getParameter("myParam"))
    .map(String::toUpperCase)
    .ifPresent(result::setText);
```

**5. Apache Commons** (if available):
```java
String value = StringUtils.defaultString(getParameter("myParam"), "default");
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**Best Practices**:
- Document required parameters in component class JavaDoc
- Log warnings when required parameters are missing
- Provide sensible defaults where possible
- Use parameter validation in doBeforeRender()
- Consider creating a ParametersInfo class with validated parameters

**Example: Robust Parameter Handling**:
```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;
    }

    // Optional parameter with default
    int maxItems = 10;
    if (limit != null) {
        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

**Common HST Parameters to Check**:
- Document picker paths
- Query parameters
- Display settings (limit, offset)
- Configuration flags
- Custom component settings

**Related Community Issues**:
- NullPointerException in component rendering
- "Component not displaying" (due to NPE in doBeforeRender)
- Parameters working locally but not on server

**HST Component Configuration**:
Component parameters are configured in repository at:
```
/hst:hst/hst:configurations/[project]/hst:components/[component]
  + hst:parameternames = ['param1', 'param2']
  + hst:parametervalues = ['value1', 'value2']
```

**References**:
- [HST Component Development](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [Component Parameters Guide](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)

```java
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());

        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
```

```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
```

ERROR Line 103:16
Parameter 'request' used inline without null check
config.component-parameter-null Configuration Problems
Show details 
The component parameter 'request' is accessed and used immediately
without any null checking. This will cause a NullPointerException if the
parameter is not configured.

**Problem**: Inline usage without assignment makes it impossible to null-check

**Example**:
```java
// ❌ PROBLEM - Inline usage
result.setText(getParameter("title").toUpperCase());
// NPE if 'title' parameter not configured!
```

**Solution**: Assign to variable first, then null-check:
```java
String title = getParameter("title");
if (title != null) {
    result.setText(title.toUpperCase());
} else {
    result.setText("Untitled");
}
```

See the main documentation for comprehensive examples and best practices.

```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());

        }
```

**Why This Happens**:
- Parameter not configured in CMS UI
- Typo in parameter name
- Component used in different context without configuration
- Configuration not published yet

```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
if (value == null) {
    logger.warn("Parameter 'myParam' not configured");
    return;
}
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**3. Default Value**:
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
String safeValue = (value != null) ? value : "defaultValue";
result.setText(safeValue.toUpperCase());
```

**4. Optional Pattern** (Modern Java):
```java
Optional.ofNullable(getParameter("myParam"))
    .map(String::toUpperCase)
    .ifPresent(result::setText);
```

**5. Apache Commons** (if available):
```java
String value = StringUtils.defaultString(getParameter("myParam"), "default");
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**Best Practices**:
- Document required parameters in component class JavaDoc
- Log warnings when required parameters are missing
- Provide sensible defaults where possible
- Use parameter validation in doBeforeRender()
- Consider creating a ParametersInfo class with validated parameters

**Example: Robust Parameter Handling**:
```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;
    }

    // Optional parameter with default
    int maxItems = 10;
    if (limit != null) {
        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

**Common HST Parameters to Check**:
- Document picker paths
- Query parameters
- Display settings (limit, offset)
- Configuration flags
- Custom component settings

**Related Community Issues**:
- NullPointerException in component rendering
- "Component not displaying" (due to NPE in doBeforeRender)
- Parameters working locally but not on server

**HST Component Configuration**:
Component parameters are configured in repository at:
```
/hst:hst/hst:configurations/[project]/hst:components/[component]
  + hst:parameternames = ['param1', 'param2']
  + hst:parametervalues = ['value1', 'value2']
```

**References**:
- [HST Component Development](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [Component Parameters Guide](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)

../johnstone-bloomreach-v14--latest-code/johnstonesupply-cms/site/components/src/main/java/com/johnstonesupply/cms/components/ProductViewPageComponent.java

2 issue(s)
WARNING Line 86:26
Parameter 'IS_NON_BRANDED' used without null check
config.component-parameter-null Configuration Problems
Show details 
The component parameter 'IS_NON_BRANDED' is accessed via getComponentParameter()
and stored in variable 'isNonBranded', but used without null checking.

**Risk**: HIGH - NullPointerException if parameter not configured

**Why This Happens**:
- Parameter not configured in CMS UI
- Typo in parameter name
- Component used in different context without configuration
- Configuration not published yet
- Parameter removed during refactoring

**Problem Pattern**:
```java
// ⚠️ PROBLEM - No null check
String value = getParameter("myParam");
result.setText(value.toUpperCase()); // NPE if value is null!
```

**Correct Patterns**:

**1. Simple Null Check** (Recommended):
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
if (value != null) {
    result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
} else {
    // Provide default or skip
    result.setText("Default Value");
}
```

**2. Early Return**:
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
if (value == null) {
    logger.warn("Parameter 'myParam' not configured");
    return;
}
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**3. Default Value**:
```java
String value = getParameter("myParam");
String safeValue = (value != null) ? value : "defaultValue";
result.setText(safeValue.toUpperCase());
```

**4. Optional Pattern** (Modern Java):
```java
Optional.ofNullable(getParameter("myParam"))
    .map(String::toUpperCase)
    .ifPresent(result::setText);
```

**5. Apache Commons** (if available):
```java
String value = StringUtils.defaultString(getParameter("myParam"), "default");
result.setText(value.toUpperCase());
```

**Best Practices**:
- Document required parameters in component class JavaDoc
- Log warnings when required parameters are missing
- Provide sensible defaults where possible
- Use parameter validation in doBeforeRender()
- Consider creating a ParametersInfo class with validated parameters

**Example: Robust Parameter Handling**:
```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;
    }

    // Optional parameter with default
    int maxItems = 10;
    if (limit != null) {
        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

- Typo in parameter name
- Component used in different context without configuration

```java
} else {
    // Provide default or skip
    result.setText("Default Value");
}
```

```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;
    }

    // Optional parameter with default
    int maxItems = 10;
    if (limit != null) {
        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;

    // Optional parameter with default
    int maxItems = 10;
    if (limit != null) {
        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

2 issue(s)
ERROR Line 198:7
Parameter 'CALL_PRICING_DIRECTLY' used inline without null check
config.component-parameter-null Configuration Problems
Show details 
The component parameter 'CALL_PRICING_DIRECTLY' is accessed and used immediately
without any null checking. This will cause a NullPointerException if the
parameter is not configured.

**Problem**: Inline usage without assignment makes it impossible to null-check

**Example**:
```java
// ❌ PROBLEM - Inline usage
result.setText(getParameter("title").toUpperCase());
// NPE if 'title' parameter not configured!
```

**Solution**: Assign to variable first, then null-check:
```java
String title = getParameter("title");
if (title != null) {
    result.setText(title.toUpperCase());
} else {
    result.setText("Untitled");
}
```

See the main documentation for comprehensive examples and best practices.

**Example: Robust Parameter Handling**:
```java
@Override
public void doBeforeRender(HstRequest request, HstResponse response) {
    String title = getParameter("title");
    String limit = getParameter("limit");

    // Validate required parameters
    if (title == null) {
        logger.warn("Required parameter 'title' not configured for component {}",
            request.getRequestContext().getResolvedSiteMapItem().getHstComponentConfiguration().getName());
        request.setAttribute("error", "Component not properly configured");
        return;
    }

    // Optional parameter with default
    int maxItems = 10;
    if (limit != null) {
        try {
            maxItems = Integer.parseInt(limit);
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            logger.warn("Invalid limit parameter: {}", limit);
        }
    }

    request.setAttribute("title", title);
    request.setAttribute("maxItems", maxItems);
}
```

**Common HST Parameters to Check**:
- Document picker paths
- Query parameters
- Display settings (limit, offset)
- Configuration flags
- Custom component settings

**Related Community Issues**:
- NullPointerException in component rendering
- "Component not displaying" (due to NPE in doBeforeRender)
- Parameters working locally but not on server

**HST Component Configuration**:
Component parameters are configured in repository at:
```
/hst:hst/hst:configurations/[project]/hst:components/[component]
  + hst:parameternames = ['param1', 'param2']
  + hst:parametervalues = ['value1', 'value2']
```

**References**:
- [HST Component Development](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
- [Component Parameters Guide](https://xmdocumentation.bloomreach.com/)
